level.heading: Presumption created by publication.
level.text: The publication of any document in the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large, the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations, or the District of Columbia Register creates a rebuttable presumption:
That it was duly issued, prescribed, adopted, or enacted; and
That all requirements of this subchapter have been complied with.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 2-153
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 2-153, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-505.
